data.title: 45 Simposio de la Asociación Española de Economía (SAEe2020)
data.text:
Session 1: Econometrics

December 10, 2020 12:00 to 14:00 Session Chair: Juan Mora, University of Alicante Session type: PhD Session contributedQuantile Structural Vector Autoregression presented by: Josef Ruzicka, Universidad Carlos III de Madrid Predictability Tests Robust to Multiple Instabilities presented by: Lukas Hoesch, Universitat Pompeu Fabra Composite Absolute Value and Sign Forecasts presented by: Andre Souza, Barcelona GSE and Universitat Pompeu Fabra Expectations and the Option Implied-Variance: Some Evidence and Theory presented by: Gaurav Mehta, Universitat Autonoma de Barcelona and Barcelona GSE Session 2: Economics of Education

December 10, 2020 12:00 to 14:00 Session Chair: Elena Del Rey, University of Girona Session type: PhD Session contributedHuman capital outcomes: knowledge vs competencies presented by: Claudia Prieto Latorre, Universidad de Malaga Higher education, mismatched jobs: gender differences in the drivers of overeducation among recent graduates[slides] presented by: David Boto-García, University of Oviedo THE IMPACT OF EDUCATION ON HEALTH AT BIRTH: CAUSAL EVIDENCE FROM SPAIN presented by: Pilar Cuevas Ruiz, University College London/University of Seville Couples are Made of Six: Intergenerational Transmission of Within-household Allocations[slides] presented by: Javier Garcia-Brazales, CEMFI Session 3: Macroeconomics (I)

December 10, 2020 12:00 to 14:00 Session Chair: Antonia Díaz, Universidad Carlos III Session type: PhD Session contributedProvider-driven complementarity and firm dynamics presented by: Sergio Feijoo Moreira, Universidad Carlos III de Madrid Exuberant and Uninformed: How Financial Markets (Mis-)Allocate Capital during Booms presented by: Ilja Kantorovitch, Universitat Pompeu Fabra The Rise of Intangible Capital and the Macroeconomic Implications presented by: Sampreet singh Goraya, University of Pompeu Fabra The Effect of Experience-Based Heterogeneity in Expectations on Monetary Policy presented by: Florian Wicknig, University of Cologne Session 4: Microeconomics (I)

December 10, 2020 12:00 to 14:00 Session Chair: Pedro Rey-Biel, ESADE Business School Session type: PhD Session contributedFooled by your Friends? Misperceptions with local network information presented by: Martin Busch, University of Copenhagen The Effects of Group Identity on Interaction Preferences and Coordination Efficiency presented by: Adrià Bronchal, Universitat Ramon Llull, ESADE Business School Conflict Initiation Function Shapes the Evolution of Persistent Outcomes in Group Conflict presented by: Pablo Marcos-Prieto, Scenes from a Monopoly: Renewable Resources and Quickest Detection of Regime Shifts presented by: Neha Deopa, The Graduate Institute of International and Development Studies Session 5: Behavioral Economics

December 10, 2020 15:00 to 17:00 Session Chair: Nagore Iriberri, University of the Basque Country Session type: PhD Session contributedLottery prize effect into consumption: Evidence from the BHPS and UKHLS presented by: Guillermo Cabanillas-Jiménez, University of Kent Risk Behavior Initiation with Behavioral agents and Social Interactions presented by: Blas Marin Lopez, University of Alicante Economic expectations in the (long) era of political bias presented by: Luis Guirola Abenza, Bank of Spain/Duke University The Effect of Incentives on Choices and Beliefs in Games: An Experiment presented by: Teresa Esteban Casanelles, Columbia University Session 6: Environmental Economics

December 10, 2020 15:00 to 17:00 Session Chair: Natalia Fabra, Universidad Carlos III de Madrid Session type: PhD Session contributedInteractions among macroeconomic policies, the energy market and environmental quality presented by: Ivan Hajdukovic, The determinants of discards in fisheries: A country approach with GAMs methodology presented by: Belén Inguanzo, University of the Basque Country (UPV-EHU) Technology Adoption and Structural Transformation: The case of tractors in France[slides] presented by: Jacint Enrich Moya, Toulouse School of Economics (TSE) Does Increasing Block Pricing Decrease Energy Use? Evidence from the Residential Electricity Market[slides] presented by: Becka Brolinson, Georgetown University Session 7: Health Economics

December 10, 2020 15:00 to 17:00 Session Chair: Sergi Jimenez-Martin, Universitat Pompeu Fabra & Barcelona GSE Session type: PhD Session contributedCivil servant public examinations and sick leave[slides] presented by: Grace Armijos Bravo, University of Barcelona - IEB Doctor Who - Can the Doctor-Patient Match Reduce the Educational Gradient in Health? presented by: Ida Kristiansen, University of Copenhagen The price of silence: Marriage transfers and women’s attitude toward intimate partner violence presented by: Suzanna Khalifa, Aix Marseille School of Economics A Two-sided Matching Model of The Pharma-Academia Collaboration under Moral Hazard presented by: Qianshuo Liu, IDEA-UAB Session 8: Industrial Organization (I)

December 10, 2020 15:00 to 17:00 Session Chair: Vicente Cunat, London School of Economics Session type: PhD Session contributedInstitutional Ownership and Firms' Innovation Strategy: Blockholders vs Motivated Monitors[slides] presented by: Dennis Hutschenreiter, Universitat Autònoma de Barcelona Age Composition of the Demand and the Secular Stagnation presented by: Daniele Angelini, European University Institute Tax-Free Digital News: Pluralism and Readership presented by: Sven Hanold, UAB and Barcelona GSE Climate Change, Incomplete Regulation, and Imperfect Competition: Evidence from South American Agriculture presented by: Tomas Dominguez-Iino, New York University Session 9: Round Table: “Economic Aspects of COVID-19”

December 10, 2020 17:30 to 19:00 Session Chair: Diego Puga, CEMFI Session type: Regular Session invited&nbsp Discussants:

1 Jose-Victor Rios-Rull, University of Pennsylvania

2 Milena Almagro Garcia, University of Chicago Booth School of Business

Session 10: Finance

December 11, 2020 12:00 to 14:00 Session Chair: Carolina Villegas Sanchez, ESADE Business School Session type: PhD Session contributedBang for the QE Buck: Examining the Impact of ECB’s Corporate Bond Purchases on Firms’ Default Risk, Debt, and Investment presented by: Lior Cohen, HANK beyond FIRE presented by: Jose Gallegos, The Labor Earnings Gap, Heterogeneous Wage Phillips Curves, and Monetary Policy presented by: Mario Giarda, Universitat Pompeu Fabra Capital Taxation and Stock Market Volatility[slides] presented by: Pau Belda, Universitat Autònoma de Barcelona - Barcelona Graduate School of Economics Session 11: Macroeconomics (II)

December 11, 2020 12:00 to 14:00 Session Chair: Xavier Raurich, Universitat de Barcelona Session type: PhD Session contributedRising from the ashes: A threshold analysis of the growth effect of institutions presented by: ESTHER ACQUAH, UNIVERSITY OF ALICANTE Free and Protected: Trade Networks and City Formation presented by: Sebastian Ellingsen, Block Ownership, Investment and Uncertainty: Evidence from U.S. Firms presented by: jinlin li, University of Exeter Mums and the City: Female Labour Participation and City Size presented by: Ana Moreno-Maldonado, European University Institute Session 12: Political Economy

December 11, 2020 12:00 to 14:00 Session Chair: Monica Martinez-Bravo, CEMFI Session type: PhD Session contributedAgricultural Modernization and Redistributive Conflict: The Struggle for Land in Brazil presented by: Stefano Falcone, Université libre de Bruxelles Més Que Un Club: Football, National Identity and Political Preferences presented by: Martin Fernandez Sanchez, Paris School of Economics Online Competition and News Quality: Evidence from the Introduction of Craigslist presented by: Milena Djourelova, UPF Session 13: Urban Economics

December 11, 2020 12:00 to 14:00 Session Chair: Nezih Guner, CEMFI Session type: PhD Session contributedHousing Prices and Urban-Land Regulations in developing countries : Evidence from Bogotá ( Colombia). presented by: Diego Buitrago, UAB The Birthplace Premium presented by: Miguel Zerecero, Toulouse School of Economics Transportation Costs and Firm Performance presented by: João Pereira dos Santos, Nova School of Business and Economics Urban criminal groups and the optimality of tough-on-crime policies presented by: Magdalena Domínguez Pérez, University of Barcelona & IEB Session 14: Education Committee Lecture: "On-line Education"

December 11, 2020 15:00 to 16:00 Session Chair: Pedro Rey-Biel, ESADE Business School Session type: invited Session 15: Industrial Organization (II)

December 11, 2020 16:30 to 18:30 Session Chair: Rosa Ferrer, Universitat Pompeu Fabra Session type: PhD Session contributedClimate Change and Migration presented by: Bruno Conte, Universitat Autonoma de Barcelona A Model of the Built-In Review Systems on Platforms and Incentives for Manipulation presented by: Faruk Yasar, IDEA - BGSE R&D Investment and Competition: A Dynamic Model in Search Engine Market[slides] presented by: BITA SHABGARD, UAB Session 16: Labor Economics

December 11, 2020 16:30 to 18:30 Session Chair: JUAN J. DOLADO, Universidad Carlos III de Madrid Session type: PhD Session contributedThe Effects of Product Innovation across the Value Chain on Different Type of Employment: An Empirical Analysis of Spanish Manufacturing Firms presented by: Guillermo Arenas, Universidad Complutense de Madrid Uniform Trade Secrets Act and Corporate Boards presented by: Sofia Martinez, Universidad Carlos III de Madrid Joint Retirement of Couples: Evidence from Discontinuities in Denmark presented by: Esteban Garcia-Miralles, University of Copenhagen New entrants facing the Great Recession: earnings and employment trajectories of young immigrants presented by: Marta Escalonilla, University of Oviedo Session 17: Microeconomics (II)

December 11, 2020 16:30 to 18:30 Session Chair: Antonio Cabrales, University College London Session type: PhD Session contributedValue-Free Reductions presented by: Chaoran Sun, Universitat Autònoma de Barcelona Robust Pricing and Reliable Projections: Statistical Mechanism Design presented by: Duarte Goncalves, Columbia University Network Information in Network Games presented by: Sofía Ruiz-Palazuelos, University of Basque Country Bidding Fear in Storage Locker Auctions[slides] presented by: Juan Sentana, University of Essex Session 18: Public Economics

December 11, 2020 16:30 to 18:30 Session Chair: Ana I. Moro-Egido, University of Granada Session type: PhD Session contributedThe Effects of Violent Crime on Marriage Markets and Intrahousehold Resource Allocation presented by: Maria Hernandez-de-Benito, Georgetown University Public good or public bad? Indigenous institutions, nation-building, and the demand for road infrastructure in Mexico[slides] presented by: Eduardo Hidalgo, University of Cologne Aid Against Trees? Evidence from a Community Driven Development Program in the Philippines[slides] presented by: Jeffrey Pagel, University of Barcelona What drives wealth inequality in the United States?
